results.title: Mots' Mansion [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Middle Videogame category. Sam, Bec and their Mother move in to Grandma’s house. But when Bec is captured, Sam needs to complete tasks given to him by the mysterious MOTS. Can he trust the Man on the Stairs and will they both make it out. In the end, the choices you make will matter.

results.title: Day One [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Videogame. In 2017, tens of thousands of Australians will battle the greatest mystery of their lives … high school. In ‘Day One’, your mission is to survive your first day of high school. You will need to find your seat in assembly, learn a new instrument, escape detention, sprint 100 metres, destroy a vending machine, and dodge rubbish bins to ultimately find your classroom.

results.title: Castlemaine Community Lunch
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Castlemaine Community Lunch is a weekly event organised by the Castlemaine Community House. It brings people together in a warm and welcoming environment, encouraging and nurturing friendships and connections. Attended by locals, old and new, it is also a chance to welcome newcomers into the community.

results.title: The Genie from down under: it's my opal and I'll cry if I want to
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Tour operator, Otto von Meister, and his nephew, Conrad, arrive at Townes Downs with a load of tourists. When he learns about the opal Otto recalls that it belonged to their family years before and he and Conrad are desperate to get it back.

results.brief_description: Penelope is desperate to win the Cross Country and she does - without any help from the genies. Penelope wishes that Conrad could see her success. He does - but not quite how Penelope would have liked.

results.title: The Gift [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Gary Lucchesi, Tom Rosenberg, James Jacks and Columbia
results.brief_description: Set in Georgia, Cate Blanchett plays Annie Wilson, a young widow with three children to look after. Following an accident that kills her husband, she relies on her psychic visions to give the townsfolk clairvoyant readings regarding their relationships and love lives to earn a little extra money. Annie receives visits from Valerie (Hilary Swank) who is married to Donnie Barksdale (Keanu Reeves), a psychotic wife abuser who warns Annie not to talk to his wife again or he will hurt her and her children. She also has to contend with his taunts of her being a witch - a feeling that is echoed by some of the locals. When young socialite Jessica King (Katie Holmes) goes missing, the local police and her fiancee ask Annie for her help in finding the body and leading them to the murderer. Screenplay by Billy Bob Thornton.

results.title: Ants in the irrigation drippers
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.

results.title: The Department manager
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Nicholas Balla, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film is centered on a mini-drama in which a successful design engineer encounters many problems when he is promoted to a managerial position. The film raises questions about the sources of job satisfaction, the perils of promotion from within the organization, and the demands that are put on a person placed for the first time in an administrative or managerial role.
